questions.question_text: Which policy configuration must be used to classify traffic as it enters the branch WAN Edge router to be put into the desired output queue?

discussion.content: class-map : Define class map to classify packets, by importance, into appropriate forwarding classes. Reference the class map in an access list. keyword classify

Selected Answer: B
Keyword "as it enters the Edge", hence you classify the entering traffic by ACL.

Selected Answer: A
Link provided by Roger95 works

Selected Answer: B
B seems correct answer, the question say "classify". The answer A create the queue but no classify traffic, the answer B classify trafic

A is correct answer
class-map use for classify input traffic 
we use acl for flowing input data into forwarding class for outgoing data then B is not correct

Selected Answer: A
Difficult but I go with A

Selected Answer: B
ACL does classify.

Selected Answer: B
Class-map maps forwarding classes to queues but it does not classify traffic. ACL does classify.

Selected Answer: A

questions.question_text: Which Cisco SD-WAN component facilitates the initial communication between WAN Edge devices to join the fabric?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is correct

Selected Answer: D
vBond controller, or orchestrator, authenticates and authorizes the SD-WAN components onto the network. The vBond orchestrator takes an added responsibility to distribute the list of vSmart and vManage controller information to the WAN Edge routers.
https://www.cisco.com/c/dam/en/us/td/docs/solutions/CVD/SDWAN/sdwan-wan-edge-onboarding-deploy-guide-2020nov.pdf

Selected Answer: D
D is correct

Selected Answer: D
Cisco vBond Orchestrator orchestrates the initial control connection between Cisco vSmart Controllers and edge routers
vBond is the gatekeeper and first point of contact, it then issues vsmart and vmanage ip addresses,

Selected Answer: D
Cisco vBond Orchestrator orchestrates the initial control connection between Cisco vSmart Controllers and edge routers.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/routers/sdwan/configuration/sdwan-xe-gs-book/system-overview.html

Cisco vBond Orchestrator orchestrates the initial control connection between Cisco vSmart Controllers and edge routers. 

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/routers/sdwan/configuration/sdwan-xe-gs-book/system-overview.html

Selected Answer: B
after Edges communicate with vBond and be authorized,

communication between Edges, will be establish after vSmart share the TLOCs and key info to all Edges, then Edges establish the IPSec connection between them.
This question should not be worded "between Edge." Edge to controller is DTLS and vBond. Between the edges themselves is vSmart.

questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibit.

//IMG//


An enterprise network is connected with an ISP network on an 80 Mbps bandwidth link. The network operation team observes 100 Mbps traffic on the 1 Gig-ISP link during peak hours.

Which configuration provides bandwidth control to avoid traffic congestion during peak hours?

discussion.content:
These questions are ridiculously vague. This is not a first case. 
There is not mentioned if it is in download or upload. 
Also if there is observed a 100Mbps traffic then there is some burst allowed .. if so, even asnwer A cannot be correct.
And by the way, the SHAPING is not a method to avoid traffic congestion !

In order to shape traffic, this needs to be done under a "policy map", utilizing the AVERAGE keyword (To avoid congestion in this case).The CIR or Committed Information Rate is set in bps (Bits Per Second)

1 MegaBit = 1000,000 bits

The ISP link has allocated the bandwidth limit of 80 Mbps 
80 Megabits = 80,000,000 bits

The Option is [A]

questions.question_text: Which protocol advertises WAN Edge routes on the service side?

discussion.content:
I found there are more very badly formulated questions on ENSDWI cert.
Cisco shouldn't ask money for this. Instead cisco should be giving money to ones who commit to take this bulk of joke questions.

Selected Answer: A
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/routers/sdwan/configuration/routing/ios-xe-17/routing-book-xe/m-unicast-routing.html#:~:text=of%20OMP%20Routes-,OMP%20Routes,from%20its%20site%2Dlocal%20network.
the question is not clear. it could be both OSPF and BGP
Bad question. Several protocols advertise routes on the service side. If they want to know which protocol is automatically redistributed into OMP on the transport side, they should have asked that.

Route Redistribution—Default Behavior
OMP automatically redistributes the following types of routes that it learns either locally or from its routing peers:
• Connected

• Static

• OSPF intra-area routes

• OSPF interarea routes


All other routing protocols require explicit configuration to enable redistribution.

So OSPF routes (intra-area or interarea routes) will be automatically redistributed to OMP.
Ans: A should be correct answer.
